revised_title: Exploring the Membrane Behavior in Nitella through Electrical Impedance
tldr: The authors investigated the behavior of the cell membrane in Nitella by measuring its electrical impedance using a micro-silver/silver chloride electrode. They found that the membrane resistance and capacity were affected by the external solution's concentration and the presence of plant-growth substances. The results provide insights into the cell membrane's complex structure and behavior, contributing to our understanding of plant physiology.
